members.name: value
members.description: The value of the form field.

members.name: label
members.description:
The label of the form field.
Must be plain text.
If label requires additional markup (e.g., superscript),
then use the label slot instead.

members.name: hideLabel
members.description:
Makes the label screen-reader-only and visually hidden.
Hiding the label is **strongly discouraged** and should only
be used when descriptive text exists elsewhere on the page.

members.name: name
members.description: The name of the form field. This is a **required** property.

members.name: fieldId
members.description:
The id of the form field.

Overrides the auto-generated id.

members.name: required
members.description: Indicates that the form field is required.

members.name: disabled
members.description: Indicates that the form field is disabled.

members.name: readonly
members.description: Indicates that the form field is readonly.

members.name: helpText
members.description:
The additional context used to assist the
user in filling out the form field.

members.name: errorMessage
members.description:
The error message to display when the form
field is in an invalid state.

members.name: formResetCallback
members.description:
Reset the field's value to it's value attribute.
This gets called when `form.reset()` is invoked
(typically by clicking a type="reset" button).

members.name: setInternalValidity
members.description:
Calls `setValidity` on the element internals
with the appropriate options depending on whether
the element has an `errorMessage` or not.

members.name: updateField
members.description: update the actual field's value

members.name: hasHelpText
members.description: Determines whether the element includes `helpText`

members.name: getAriaDescribedBy
members.description:
Gets the appropriate `aria-describedby` value
based on the existence of `helpText` and `errorMessage`.

members.name: getFieldId
members.description: Gets the "fieldId" value

members.name: verifyLabel
members.description:
Determines whether the element has a label.
Console logs an error, if not.

members.name: labelTemplate
members.description:
Creates an HTML template for the label
that is tied to the form field via the `for`
attribute and adds the required indicator,
if applicable.

members.name: helpTextTemplate
members.description:
Creates an HTML template for help text,
if the element has help text.
Adds an `id` that is included in the form field's
aria-describedby attribute.

members.name: errorMessageTemplate
members.description:
Creates an HTML template for error message,
if the `errorMessage` prop is defined.
Adds an `id` that is included in the form field's
aria-describedby attribute.

PdsBand

slots.description: This slot holds the html elements within the band
slots.name: default

members.name: variant
members.description:
Style variant
- **default** renders the band using no background
- **subtle** renders the band using the subtle background token
- **strong** renders the band using the strong background token
- **brand-default** renders the band using the brand-default background token
- **brand-strong** renders the band using the brand-strong background token
- **brand-xstrong** renders the band using the brand-xstrong background token
- **brand-gradient-strong** renders the band using the brand-gradient-strong background token
- **brand-gradient-xstrong** renders the band using the brand-gradient-xstrong background token

members.name: rounded
members.description: Rounded

members.name: spacing
members.description:
Spacing variants
- default (no spacing property added) provides 64px of top/bottom padding on md/lg screens
 and 32px of top/bottom padding on sm screens
- **none** renders no top and bottom padding. Content within the band will create the spacing
- **sm** provides 32px of top/bottom padding on md/lg screens and 16px of top/bottom padding
 on sm screens
- **lg** provides 128px of top/bottom padding on md/lg screens and 64px of top/bottom padding
 on sm screens

members.name: buttonVariant
members.description:
Style buttonVariant
- **default** renders the button used for the most common calls to action that don't require as much visual attention.
- **default-inverted** renders a default button for use on darker backgrounds.
- **primary** renders the button used for the most important calls to action.
- **primary-inverted** renders a primary button for use on darker backgrounds.
- **icon** renders the button used for icon.
- **icon-inverted** renders the button for icons used on darker backgrounds.

members.name: variant
members.description:
Style variant
- **information** default, renders the alert used for informational alerts
- **success** renders the alert used for success alerts
- **error** renders the alert used for error alerts, is not dismissible
- **warning** renders the alert used for warning alerts
- **banner** renders the alert used for banner alerts, by default includes a layout-container

members.name: layoutContainerVariant
members.description:
Determines if we should place the header in a layout container
If this property isn't passed, no layout container is used.

members.name: layoutContainerRemovePadding
members.description:
Remove layout container padding (only to be used if layoutContainerVariant has a value)
- **md** removes padding from the layout container below md breakpoint
- **all** removes padding from the layout container at all screens (used for nested layout containers)

members.description: Hide dismiss button

members.name: variant
members.description:
**default** renders the button used for the most common calls to action that don't require as much visual attention.
- **default-inverted** renders a default button for use on darker backgrounds.
- **primary** renders the button used for the most important calls to action.
- **primary-inverted** renders a primary button for use on darker backgrounds.
- **icon** renders the button used for icon.
- **icon-inverted** renders the button for icons used on darker backgrounds.

members.name: disabled
members.description: Disabled button

members.name: fullWidth
members.description: FullWidth button

members.name: type
members.description:
**submit** specifies submit type button for form-data submit, default
- **reset** specifies reset type button for form-data reset
- **button** specifies clickable button type

members.name: link
members.description:
Render the button as a link variant

- **default** renders link for basic action
- **emphasis** provide more affordance
- **inverted** used on a darker background
- **emphasis-inverted** more affordance on a darker background
- **icon-left** link with icon left
- **icon-right** link with icon right

members.name: removeLinkPadding
members.description: Remove padding from link button. Default is false.

members.description: An element ID which identifies the element (or elements) that describes the element on which the attribute is set.

members.name: isActive
members.description:
This is a faux focus effect to show the effect of being focused without
actually being focused.

members.name: variant
members.description:
**default** renders a card with a subtle border and padding
- **bare** renders a card without a border or drop shadow

members.name: borderRadiusSize
members.description:
**default** renders a card with a border radius of 8px
- **sm** renders a card with a border radius of 4px

members.name: centerContentVertically
members.description: Adds an additional class for aligning items to the vertical center of the card.

members.name: direction
members.description:
**default** renders a card in a vertical format
- **horizontal** renders a card in a horizontal format

members.name: href
members.description:
Provides the src value for the href card, renders a clickable card
styled with a drop shadow but no border

members.name: target
members.description:
Used in combination with the href property to determine the target
for the clickable card. Not providing a value opens link in the same tab.
For a complete list of valid strings, see https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/document-sequences.html#valid-navigable-target-name-or-keyword

members.name: ariaLabel
members.description: ARIA label string that describes a clickable pds-card for screen reader users

members.name: removePadding
members.description:
If true, this property will remove the default padding from the card and
the content will extend all the way to the edges

members.name: handleMouseout
members.description:
On mouseout, a clickable card will remove the attribute 'hover' on
elements with a class of .pds-c-card__element-with-hover-state

members.name: handleSlotChange
members.description:
This function checks for <pds-link> and <a> tags within the card,
(first as the only slotted item, then as a child of a slotted item)
and then adds the hover class that is targeted to provide the hover
attribute when a clickable card is hovered.

The <pds-link> tag will handle the hover effect due to the built
in support for the 'hover' attribute. An <a> tag will need to have
the hover effect coded by the consuming application.

members.description:
Creates an HTML template for the label
that is tied to the form field via the `for`
attribute and adds the required indicator,
if applicable.

members.name: label
members.description:
The label of the form field.
Must be plain text.
If label requires additional markup (e.g., superscript),
then use the label slot instead.

members.name: hideLabel
members.description:
Makes the label screen-reader-only and visually hidden.
Hiding the label is **strongly discouraged** and should only
be used when descriptive text exists elsewhere on the page.

members.name: name
members.description: The name of the form field. This is a **required** property.

members.name: fieldId
members.description:
The id of the form field.

Overrides the auto-generated id.

members.description: Indicates that the form field is required.

members.name: disabled

members.name: readonly
members.description: Indicates that the form field is readonly.

members.name: helpText
members.description:
The additional context used to assist the
user in filling out the form field.

members.name: errorMessage
members.description:
The error message to display when the form
field is in an invalid state.

members.name: setInternalValidity
members.description:
Calls `setValidity` on the element internals
with the appropriate options depending on whether
the element has an `errorMessage` or not.

members.name: updateField
members.description: update the actual field's value

members.name: hasHelpText
members.description: Determines whether the element includes `helpText`

members.name: getAriaDescribedBy
members.description:
Gets the appropriate `aria-describedby` value
based on the existence of `helpText` and `errorMessage`.

members.name: getFieldId
members.description: Gets the "fieldId" value

members.name: verifyLabel
members.description:
Determines whether the element has a label.
Console logs an error, if not.

members.name: helpTextTemplate
members.description:
Creates an HTML template for help text,
if the element has help text.
Adds an `id` that is included in the form field's
aria-describedby attribute.

members.name: errorMessageTemplate
members.description:
Creates an HTML template for error message,
if the `errorMessage` prop is defined.
Adds an `id` that is included in the form field's
aria-describedby attribute.

declarations.default:
{
  name: 'Multiple items',
  args: { variant: 'default' },
  parameters: {
    actions: {
      handles: ['pds-collapsible-open', 'pds-collapsible-close'],
    },
  },
  render: (args) =>
    html`<pds-collapsible variant="${args.variant}" ?open="${args.open}"
        ><span slot="summary-title">What is a 1099 tax form?</span
        ><span slot="collapsible-content"
          >Form 1099 is a series of forms described by the Internal Revenue
          Service (IRS) as information returns, used to report income other
          than a regular salary.</span
        >
      </pds-collapsible>
      <pds-collapsible variant="${args.variant}" ?open="${args.open}"
        ><span slot="summary-title">What is a 1098 tax form?</span
        ><span slot="collapsible-content"
          >Form 1098 is a series of forms described by the Internal Revenue
          Service (IRS) as information returns, used to report income other
          than a regular salary.</span
        >
      </pds-collapsible>`,
}

members.description: Toggle the collapsible to either open or closed.

members.name: close
members.description: Close the collapsible by setting the height of the details element to the height of the summary element

members.name: expand
members.description: Open the collapsible by setting the height of the details elememt to the height of the summary and content elements

members.name: animateExpand
members.description: Start the expand animation

members.name: onAnimationFinish
members.description:
When the animation is finished ensure that the details element's
open attribute is set to the correct value and the height
and overflow properties are reset.

declarations.name: columnsModelOne
declarations.default:
html`<!-- Column definitions begin -->
  <pds-data-table-columns slot="columns">
    <pds-data-table-column columnId="firstName">
      First name</pds-data-table-column
    >

    <pds-data-table-column columnId="lastName">Last name</pds-data-table-column>

    <pds-data-table-column columnId="alterEgo">
      Alter ego
    </pds-data-table-column>

    <pds-data-table-column columnId="salary" align="right">
      Salary
    </pds-data-table-column>

    <pds-data-table-column
      header="Action"
      width="150px"
      align="center"
      columnId="actionMenu"
      type="display"
      disableSort
    >
      <pds-action-menu label="I want to...">
        <pds-action-menu-item
          arialabel="Action 1"
          onClick="console.log('Click from ' + event.target.textContent + ' in row index  ' + event.target.closest('.pds-c-table__tr').getAttribute('key'))"
          >Action 1</pds-action-menu-item
        >
        <pds-action-menu-item
          arialabel="Action 2"
          onClick="console.log('Click from ' + event.target.textContent + ' in row index  ' + event.target.closest('.pds-c-table__tr').getAttribute('key'))"
          >Action 2</pds-action-menu-item
        >
        <pds-action-menu-item

slots.description: Must be populated with a pds-heading to caption the table for accessibility, may be visually hidden with the hideCaption property
slots.name: caption

slots.description: Can be populated with a single <pds-data-table-columns slot="columns"> component
slots.name: columns

slots.description: Can be populated with a single <pds-data-table-rows slot="rows"> component
slots.name: rows

members.name: hideCaption
members.description: Boolean to visually hide the caption, default is false

members.name: striped
members.description:
String to determine if the table should have "zebra" striping

- odd: striping on odd rows
- even: striping on even rows
- default: no striping

members.name: removeBorder
members.description: Boolean to remove the borders and rounded corners of the table, default is false.

members.name: hoverableRows
members.description: Boolean to add hoverable rows functionality to the table.  Default is false.

members.name: stickyHeader
members.description:
Boolean to set the header row to sticky, default is false.

Sticky row header will stick to the top of the page when scrolled away unless the table is fixed height, in which case it will stick to the top of the scrollable container.

members.name: stickyColumn
members.description: Boolean to set the first column to sticky, default is false.

members.name: fixedHeight
members.description: String to set a fixed height for the table. Example values: 300px, .25vh, 25%

members.name: hideFilter
members.description: Boolean to hide filter input for the table, default is false.

members.name: globalFilter
members.description: Global filter value, defaults to ''

members.name: paginationVariant
members.description:
Pagination style variant
- **default** renders full pagination
- **arrows** renders only arrows for pagination navigation, should only be used when horizontal space is extremely limited
- **no-arrows** renders pagination navigation without arrows, should only be used when there are only two or three pages of data
- **none** disable pagination

members.name: pageSize
members.description: Pagination page size, default is 5. Also used to determine loading state rows.

members.name: paginationSelectArray
members.description: Pagination page size array, default is [ ${pageSize}, 10, 25 ]. Used in the pagination select.

members.name: expandAllOnLoad
members.description: Boolean to expand all rows on a collapsible table on initial page load, default is false

members.name: loadingColumnLength
members.description: Number of columns to show in loading state, default is 4.

members.name: disableAllSorting
members.description: Boolean to disable all column sorting.  Default is false.

members.name: columns
members.description:
Column definitions - see https://tanstack.com/table/v8/docs/guide/column-defs

- this array holds the data that is currently defining the columns in the table
- data can be passed directly to this state as an array in order to display data without using the subcomponent data model, note that not all TanStack table options are currently supported by PDS

members.name: data
members.description:
Table data array

- this array holds the data that is currently rendered in the table
- data can be passed directly to this state as an array of objects in order to display data without using the subcomponent data model, see the provided example story
- include a filterableContent key to add content that can be filtered against but not displayed
- include a subRows key with an array of sub row objects to make a collapsible row, row will use the same column structure as main table rows unless you include a fullWidth key that will span all columns in the expandable row (this key can contain HTML markup to render)

members.name: createTable
members.description: Create a new table instance based on the component properties.

members.description:

adding the appropriate prefix to each class name

members.name: value
members.description: The value of the form field.

members.name: label
members.description:
The label of the form field.
Must be plain text.
If label requires additional markup (e.g., superscript),
then use the label slot instead.

members.name: hideLabel
members.description:
Makes the label screen-reader-only and visually hidden.
Hiding the label is **strongly discouraged** and should only
be used when descriptive text exists elsewhere on the page.

members.name: name
members.description: The name of the form field. This is a **required** property.

members.name: fieldId
members.description:
The id of the form field.

Overrides the auto-generated id.

members.description: Indicates that the form field is required.

members.name: disabled

members.name: readonly
members.description: Indicates that the form field is readonly.

members.name: helpText
members.description:
The additional context used to assist the
user in filling out the form field.

members.name: errorMessage
members.description:
The error message to display when the form
field is in an invalid state.

members.name: formResetCallback
members.description:
Reset the field's value to it's value attribute.
This gets called when `form.reset()` is invoked
(typically by clicking a type="reset" button).

members.name: setInternalValidity
members.description:
Calls `setValidity` on the element internals
with the appropriate options depending on whether
the element has an `errorMessage` or not.

members.name: getAriaDescribedBy

Gets the appropriate `aria-describedby` value
based on the existence of `helpText` and `errorMessage`.

members.name: getFieldId
members.description: Gets the "fieldId" value

members.name: verifyLabel
members.description:
Determines whether the element has a label.
Console logs an error, if not.

members.description:
Creates an HTML template for the label
that is tied to the form field via the `for`
attribute and adds the required indicator,
if applicable.

Creates an HTML template for help text,
if the element has help text.
Adds an `id` that is included in the form field's
aria-describedby attribute.

members.name: errorMessageTemplate

declarations.default:
{
  title: 'Components/Error page',
  component: 'pds-error-page',
  tags: ['autodocs'],
  argTypes: {
    linkText: { control: 'text' },
    helpHref: { control: 'text' },
    layoutContainerVariant: { control: 'text' },
  },
  render: (args) =>
    html`<pds-error-page
      errorCode="${args.errorCode || nothing}"
      linkText="${args.linkText || '[Insert link here]'}"
      linkHref="${args.linkHref || 'https://www.principal.com'}"
    >
    </pds-error-page>`,
}

Error403

PdsErrorPage

members.name: errorCode
members.description:
Style errorCode
- **403** renders the error-page used to indicate the authentication failure
- **404** renders the error-page used to indicate the broken link or if the page is moved
- **500** renders the error-page used to indicate the server is unavailable due to internal configuration issue or a temporary glitch
- **503** renders the error-page used to indicate if the site is unreachable, usually due to planned maintenance

declarations.summary: A component that renders a single link list at desktop and a collapsible at mobile

declarations.name: meta
Default
Spanish
Subtle
declarations.default:
{
  name: 'Subtle',
  args: {
    variant: 'subtle',
  },
  parameters: {
    happo: {
      delay: 1000,
    },
  },
  render: (args) =>
    html`<pds-footer variant="${args.variant}" behavior="${args.behavior}">
      <pds-list slot="custom-legal-links">
        <pds-list-item>
          <pds-link
            variant="${args.variant === 'default' ? 'inverted' : 'default'}"
            href="#"
            >Link 1</pds-link
          >
        </pds-list-item>
        <pds-list-item>
          <pds-link
            variant="${args.variant === 'default' ? 'inverted' : 'default'}"
            href="#"
            >Link 2</pds-link
          >
        </pds-list-item>
      </pds-list>
    </pds-footer>`,
}

declarations.name: Login
declarations.default:
{
  name: 'Login',
  args: {
    variant: 'default',
    behavior: 'login',
  },
  parameters: {
    happo: {
      delay: 1000,
    },
  },
  render: (args) =>
    html`<pds-footer variant="${args.variant}" behavior="${args.behavior}">
      <pds-list slot="custom-legal-links">
        <pds-list-item>
          <pds-link
            variant="${args.variant === 'default' ? 'inverted' : 'default'}"
            href="#"
            >Link 1</pds-link
          >
        </pds-list-item>
        <pds-list-item>

- **email** renders a footer-contact-link with a mail icon
- **help** renders a footer-contact-link with a help-circle icon
- **fax** renders a footer-contact-link with a print icon

declarations.name: PdsGrid

slots.description: Contains grid items within the layout configuration, restricted to pds-grid-item elements
slots.name: default

members.name: variant
members.description:
**default** renders the grid item stacked with a gap in between
- **2up** yields a grid whose grid items are stacked on small screens but display side-by-side when enough screen real estate is available to do so
- **3up** yields a grid whose grid items are stacked on small screens, transforms to a 2-across pattern, and ultimately transforms to a 3-across pattern
- **1-2-4up** yields a grid whose grid items are stacked on small screens, transforms to a 2-across pattern, and ultimately transforms to a 4-across pattern
- **1-3up** yields a grid whose grid items are stacked on small screens transforms to a 3-across pattern on larger screens
- **side-by-side** yields a grid whose grid items don't necessarily ever need to stack and displayed side-by-side for all the viewports

members.name: gap
members.description:
**default** grid items are spaced with a gap
- **none** grid items are spaced with no gap between items
- **sm** grid items are spaced with smaller gap than default
- **lg** grid items are spaced with large gap than default

members.name: break
members.description:
**default** stacks at default viewport
- **faster** stacks at a smaller viewport than the default
- **slower** stacks at a larger viewport than the default

members.description:

adding the appropriate prefix to each class name

members.name: headingTag
members.description:
Dynamic tag name for the component This is needed to use proper semantic heading treatments depending on where the banner lives on the page
  • **h1** renders an `h1` tag

  • **h3** renders an `h3` tag
  • **h4** renders an `h4` tag
  • **h5** renders an `h5` tag
  • **h6** renders an `h6` tag

slots.name: default

members.name: footnoteId
members.description:
The ID used to link together the footnote-item and the footnote-link on the page. This has to match the ID of the footnote-item for it to work properly.
The text will be replaced with the index of the footnote

members.name: variant
members.description:
**default** renders link for basic action
- **inverted** used on a darker background

members.name: size
members.description:
**default** renders default size
- **sm** smaller size
- **lg** larger size (not valid for link button)
- **xl** extra large size (not valid for link button)

members.name: href
members.description: Redirect url

members.name: download
members.description: Indicates that the link references a file to download, see https://www.w3schools.com/tags/att_a_download.asp

members.name: rel
members.description:
Specifies information about a linked document
Automatically set to 'noopener noreferrer' when target is '_blank'

members.name: hreflang
members.description: Specifies the two-character language code of the document in the link

members.name: target
members.description: Specifes target to open the linked document

members.name: ariaLabel
members.description: Specifies an aria-label for the link

members.name: ariaCurrent
members.description: Specifies an aria-current for the link

members.name: role
members.description: Specifies a role for the link

members.name: type
members.description:
Specifies the Internet media type (formerly known as MIME type)
of the linked document for links, or the type of button if button
property is true

members.name: button
members.description:
Render the link as a button variant

- **default** renders the button used for the most common calls to action that don't require as much visual attention.
- **default-inverted** renders a default button for use on darker backgrounds.
- **primary** renders the button used for the most important calls to action.
- **primary-inverted** renders a primary button for use on darker backgrounds.
- **icon** renders the button used for icon.
- **icon-inverted** renders the button for icons used on darker backgrounds.

members.name: hover
members.description: Programatically indicate a link should display as hover state

members.name: variant
members.description:
**default** renders link for basic action
- **emphasis** provide more affordance
- **inverted** used on a darker background
- **emphasis-inverted** more affordance on a darker background

members.name: size
members.description:
**default** renders default size
- **sm** smaller size
- **lg** larger size (not valid for link button)
- **xl** extra large size (not valid for link button)

members.name: href
members.description: Redirect url

members.name: download
members.description: Indicates that the link references a file to download, see https://www.w3schools.com/tags/att_a_download.asp

members.name: rel
members.description:
Specifies information about a linked document
Automatically set to 'noopener noreferrer' when target is '_blank'

members.name: hreflang
members.description: Specifies the two-character language code of the document in the link

members.name: target
members.description: Specifes target to open the linked document

members.name: ariaLabel
members.description: Specifies an aria-label for the link

members.name: ariaCurrent
members.description: Specifies an aria-current for the link

members.name: role
members.description: Specifies a role for the link

members.name: type
members.description:
Specifies the Internet media type (formerly known as MIME type)
of the linked document for links, or the type of button if button
property is true

members.name: button
members.description:
Render the link as a button variant

- **default** renders the button used for the most common calls to action that don't require as much visual attention.
- **default-inverted** renders a default button for use on darker backgrounds.
- **primary** renders the button used for the most important calls to action.
- **primary-inverted** renders a primary button for use on darker backgrounds.
- **icon** renders the button used for icon.
- **icon-inverted** renders the button for icons used on darker backgrounds.

  },
  render: () =>
    html`<pds-button
        @click=${() =>
          document.querySelector<PdsModal>('pds-modal')?.openModal()}
        >Open modal</pds-button
      ><pds-modal size="default" modalTitle="Modal heading">
        <pds-text-passage linelength="none">
          Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do
          eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad
          minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut
          aliquip ex ea commodo consequat.
        </pds-text-passage>
        <pds-button
          variant="primary"
          slot="footer"
          @click=${(e: MouseEvent) =>
            document.querySelector<PdsModal>('pds-modal')?.closeModal(e)}
          >Button</pds-button
        >
      </pds-modal>`,
}

declarations.description:
The base class for form elements.
All field properties are reflected due to this bug: https://github.com/lit/lit/issues/3912
declarations.name: PdsFormElement

members.name: value
members.description: The value of the form field.

members.name: label
members.description:
The label of the form field.
Must be plain text.
If label requires additional markup (e.g., superscript),
then use the label slot instead.

members.name: hideLabel
members.description:
Makes the label screen-reader-only and visually hidden.
Hiding the label is **strongly discouraged** and should only
be used when descriptive text exists elsewhere on the page.

members.name: name
members.description: The name of the form field. This is a **required** property.

members.name: fieldId
members.description:
The id of the form field.

Overrides the auto-generated id.

members.name: required
members.description: Indicates that the form field is required.

members.name: disabled
members.description: Indicates that the form field is disabled.

members.name: readonly
members.description: Indicates that the form field is readonly.

members.name: helpText
members.description:
The additional context used to assist the
user in filling out the form field.

members.name: errorMessage
members.description:
The error message to display when the form
field is in an invalid state.

members.name: formResetCallback
members.description:
Reset the field's value to it's value attribute.
This gets called when `form.reset()` is invoked
(typically by clicking a type="reset" button).

members.name: setInternalValidity
members.description:
Calls `setValidity` on the element internals
with the appropriate options depending on whether
the element has an `errorMessage` or not.

members.name: updateField
members.description: update the actual field's value

members.name: hasHelpText
members.description: Determines whether the element includes `helpText`

members.name: getAriaDescribedBy
members.description:
Gets the appropriate `aria-describedby` value
based on the existence of `helpText` and `errorMessage`.

members.name: getFieldId
members.description: Gets the "fieldId" value

members.name: verifyLabel
members.description:
Determines whether the element has a label.
Console logs an error, if not.

members.name: labelTemplate
members.description:
Creates an HTML template for the label
that is tied to the form field via the `for`
attribute and adds the required indicator,
if applicable.

members.name: helpTextTemplate
members.description:
Creates an HTML template for help text,
if the element has help text.
Adds an `id` that is included in the form field's
aria-describedby attribute.

members.name: errorMessageTemplate
members.description:
Creates an HTML template for error message,
if the `errorMessage` prop is defined.
Adds an `id` that is included in the form field's
aria-describedby attribute.

declarations.default:
{
  title: 'Components/Primary navigation',
  component: 'pds-primary-navigation',
  tags: ['autodocs'],
  parameters: {
    happo: {
      delay: 500,
    },
    layout: 'fullscreen',
    actions: {
      handles: [
        'pds-primary-navigation-item-click',
        'pds-primary-navigation-notification-link-click',
        'pds-primary-navigation-panel-open',
        'pds-primary-navigation-panel-close',
        'pds-primary-navigation-menu-button-open',
        'pds-primary-navigation-menu-button-close',
        'pds-primary-navigation-main-menu-dropdown-open',
        'pds-primary-navigation-main-menu-dropdown-close',
        'pds-primary-navigation-main-menu-link-click',
        'pds-primary-navigation-utility-menu-item-click',
      ],
    },
    a11y: {
      config: {
        rules: [
          {
            // None of the nested elements are interactive - this is a false positive.
            //
            // @link https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.4/nested-interactive
            id: 'nested-interactive',
            enabled: false,
          },
          {
            // The skip link target will exist on real apps, but we don't have it in Storybook.
            //
            // @link https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.4/skip-link
            id: 'skip-link',
            enabled: false,
          },
          {
            // Color contrast is sufficient - axe was having trouble grabbing the colors for this element.
            //
            // @link https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.6/color-contrast
            id: 'color-contrast',
            enabled: false,
          },
        ],
      },
    },
  },
  argTypes: {
    variant: {
      control: 'select',
      options: ['default', 'inverted'],
    },
    layoutContainerVariant: {
      control: 'select',
      options: ['default', 'narrow', ''],
    },
    layoutContainerRemovePadding: {
      control: 'text',
    },
    loginLink: {
      control: 'select',
      options: ['none', 'login', 'logout', 'customLogout'],
    },
    loginLinkVariant: {
      control: 'select',
      options: ['default', 'default-inverted', 'primary', 'primary-inverted'],
    },
  },
  render: (args) =>
    html`<pds-primary-navigation
      variant="${args.variant || nothing}"
      includeAction="${args.includeAction || nothing}"
      messagesCount="${args.messagesCount || 0}"
      otherAlertsCount="${args.otherAlertsCount || nothing}"
      loginLink="${args.loginLink || nothing}"
      loginLinkVariant="${args.loginLinkVariant || nothing}"
      layoutContainerVariant="${args.layoutContainerVariant || nothing}"
      layoutContainerRemovePadding="${args.layoutContainerRemovePadding ||
      nothing}"
    >
      <pds-primary-navigation-main-menu
        slot="primary-navigation-main-menu"
        ariaLabel="Main navigation area"
      >
        <pds-primary-navigation-main-menu-item dropdown text="Dropdown">
          <pds-list size="sm" spacing="sm">
            <pds-list-item
              ><pds-primary-navigation-dropdown-link href="#"
                >This is a link</pds-primary-navigation-dropdown-link
              ></pds-list-item
            >
            <pds-list-item
              ><pds-primary-navigation-dropdown-link href="#"
                >This is a link</pds-primary-navigation-dropdown-link
              ></pds-list-item
            >
            <pds-list-item
              ><pds-primary-navigation-dropdown-link href="#"
                >This is a link</pds-primary-navigation-dropdown-link
              ></pds-list-item
            >
            <pds-list-item
              ><pds-primary-navigation-dropdown-link href="#"
                >This is a link</pds-primary-navigation-dropdown-link
              ></pds-list-item
            >
          </pds-list>
        </pds-primary-navigation-main-menu-item>
        <pds-primary-navigation-main-menu-item megamenu text="Megamenu">
          <pds-grid variant="1-3up" break="slower">
            <pds-grid-item>
              <placeholder-element>Item 1</placeholder-element>
            </pds-grid-item>
            <pds-grid-item>
              <placeholder-element>Item 2</placeholder-element>
            </pds-grid-item>
            <pds-grid-item>
              <placeholder-element>Item 3</placeholder-element>
            </pds-grid-item>
            <pds-grid-item>
              <placeholder-element>Item 4</placeholder-element>
            </pds-grid-item>
            <pds-grid-item>
              <placeholder-element>Item 5</placeholder-element>
            </pds-grid-item>
            <pds-grid-item>
              <placeholder-element>Item 6</placeholder-element>
            </pds-grid-item>
          </pds-grid>
        </pds-primary-navigation-main-menu-item>
        <pds-primary-navigation-main-menu-item
          href="#"
          text="Link"
        ></pds-primary-navigation-main-menu-item> </pds-primary-navigation-main-menu
      ><pds-primary-navigation-utility-menu
        slot="primary-navigation-utility-menu"
        ><pds-primary-navigation-utility-menu-item href="#"
          >Link</pds-primary-navigation-utility-menu-item
        ></pds-primary-navigation-utility-menu
      ></pds-primary-navigation
    >`,
}

{
  name: 'Default',
  args: {
    variant: 'default',
  },
  parameters: {
    backgrounds: {
      default: 'Default',
    },
    happo: {
      beforeScreenshot: () => {
        const clickEvent = new MouseEvent('click', {
          view: window,
          bubbles: true,
          cancelable: false,
        });

        document
          ?.querySelector('pds-primary-navigation')
          ?.shadowRoot?.querySelector('.pds-c-primary-navigation__inner')
          ?.querySelector('.pds-c-primary-navigation__buttons-nav')
          ?.querySelector('pds-button')
          ?.dispatchEvent(clickEvent);

        document
          ?.querySelector('pds-primary-navigation')
          ?.querySelectorAll('pds-primary-navigation-main-menu-item')[0]
          ?.shadowRoot?.querySelector('button')
          ?.dispatchEvent(clickEvent);
      },
      delay: 500,
    },
  },
  render: (args) =>
    html`<pds-primary-navigation
      variant="${args.variant}"

members.name: variant
members.description:
Style variant
- **default** renders the primary-navigation used for primary actions
- **inverted** renders the primary-navigation used for primary actions

members.name: includeAction
members.description:
Determines if search | notifications should be rendered
- **search** renders the search icon & panel in the navigation
- **notification** renders the notification bell & panel in the navigation

members.name: layoutContainerVariant
members.description:
Determines if we should place the header in a layout container
If this property isn't passed, no layout container is used.

members.name: layoutContainerRemovePadding
members.description:
Remove layout container padding (only to be used if layoutContainerVariant has a value)
- **md** removes padding from the layout container below md breakpoint
- **all** removes padding from the layout container at all screens (used for nested layout containers)

members.name: hideOtherAlerts
members.description: Gives users some flexibility if they don't want other notifications to show in the notifications panel

members.name: messagesCount
members.description: The number of unread messages

members.name: otherAlertsCount
members.description: The number of other unread notifications

members.name: messagesHref
members.description: Link to the message center

members.name: otherAlertsHref
members.description: Link to the notifications center

members.name: skipToContentHref
members.description: Link to the main content or 'none' to disable the skip content link

members.name: initializeMainMenuTrap
members.description: Initialize the focus trap for main menu

members.name: initializeNotificationPanelTrap
members.description: Initialize the focus trap for notifications panel

members.name: initializeSearchPanelTrap
members.description: Initialize the focus trap for search panel

members.name: logoHref
members.description: Link for the logo

members.name: logoAriaLabel
members.description:
String for a custom aria label describing the logo element
- By default, aria label for the logo will read "Link to Principal homepage"
- Pass a string of "false" in order to suppress the aria label attribute

members.name: loginLink
members.description:
Link for the log in link button

- if **customLogout** is designated, a semantic button element will be rendered instead of a link and the application will be responsible for providing logout behavior when the pds-primary-navigation-item-click event is caught

members.name: loginLinkVariant
members.description: Variant for the log in link; valid values should match the link component's button attribute allowed values

members.name: loginLinkHref
members.description: Href for the log in link button

members.description:

adding the appropriate prefix to each class name

members.name: value
members.description: The value of the form field.

members.name: size
members.description:
The size of the component.

- **default**
- **sm** renders a the small version of the input

NOTE: This is NOT the HTML size attribute that controls the width of the input.

members.name: minLength
members.description:
Standard input minlength attribute.
See [HTML attribute: minlength](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/minlength)

members.name: maxLength
members.description:
Standard input maxlength attribute.
See [HTML attribute: maxlength](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/maxlength)

members.name: pattern
members.description:
Standard input pattern attribute.
See [HTML attribute: pattern](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/pattern)

members.name: autocomplete
members.description:
Standard input autocomplete attribute.
See [HTML attribute: autocomplete](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/autocomplete)

members.name: updateField
members.description: update the actual field's value

members.name: label
members.description:
The label of the form field.
Must be plain text.
If label requires additional markup (e.g., superscript),
then use the label slot instead.

members.name: hideLabel
members.description:
Makes the label screen-reader-only and visually hidden.
Hiding the label is **strongly discouraged** and should only
be used when descriptive text exists elsewhere on the page.

members.name: name
members.description: The name of the form field. This is a **required** property.

members.name: fieldId
members.description:
The id of the form field.

Overrides the auto-generated id.

members.name: required
members.description: Indicates that the form field is required.

members.name: disabled
members.description: Indicates that the form field is disabled.

members.name: readonly
members.description: Indicates that the form field is readonly.

members.name: helpText
members.description:
The additional context used to assist the
user in filling out the form field.

members.name: errorMessage
members.description:
The error message to display when the form
field is in an invalid state.

members.name: formResetCallback
members.description:
Reset the field's value to it's value attribute.
This gets called when `form.reset()` is invoked
(typically by clicking a type="reset" button).

members.name: setInternalValidity
members.description:
Calls `setValidity` on the element internals
with the appropriate options depending on whether
the element has an `errorMessage` or not.

members.name: hasHelpText
members.description: Determines whether the element includes `helpText`

members.name: getAriaDescribedBy
members.description:
Gets the appropriate `aria-describedby` value
based on the existence of `helpText` and `errorMessage`.

members.name: getFieldId
members.description: Gets the "fieldId" value

members.name: verifyLabel
members.description:
Determines whether the element has a label.
Console logs an error, if not.

members.name: labelTemplate
members.description:
Creates an HTML template for the label
that is tied to the form field via the `for`
attribute and adds the required indicator,
if applicable.

members.name: helpTextTemplate
members.description:
Creates an HTML template for help text,
if the element has help text.
Adds an `id` that is included in the form field's
aria-describedby attribute.

members.name: errorMessageTemplate
members.description:
Creates an HTML template for error message,
if the `errorMessage` prop is defined.
Adds an `id` that is included in the form field's
aria-describedby attribute.

declarations.name: meta
declarations.default:
{
  title: 'Components/Primary navigation/Primary navigation main menu',
  component: 'pds-primary-navigation-main-menu',
  tags: ['autodocs'],
  parameters: {
    happo: false,
    actions: {
      handles: [
        'pds-primary-navigation-item-click',
        'pds-primary-navigation-main-menu-dropdown-close',
        'pds-primary-navigation-main-menu-dropdown-open',
        'pds-primary-navigation-main-menu-link-click',
      ],
    },
    docs: {
      description: {
        component:
          'Note: This component is ONLY meant to be used as a subcomponent slotted within the primary navigation component.',
      },
    },
  },
  render: (args) =>
    html` <pds-primary-navigation-main-menu
      variant="${args.variant}"
      ariaLabel=${args.ariaLabel}
    >
      <pds-primary-navigation-main-menu-item dropdown text="Dropdown">
        <pds-list size="sm" spacing="sm">
          <pds-list-item
            ><pds-primary-navigation-dropdown-link href="#"
              >This is a link</pds-primary-navigation-dropdown-link
            ></pds-list-item
          >
          <pds-list-item
            ><pds-primary-navigation-dropdown-link href="#"
              >This is a link</pds-primary-navigation-dropdown-link
            ></pds-list-item
          >
          <pds-list-item
            ><pds-primary-navigation-dropdown-link href="#"
              >This is a link</pds-primary-navigation-dropdown-link
            ></pds-list-item
          >
          <pds-list-item
            ><pds-primary-navigation-dropdown-link href="#"
              >This is a link</pds-primary-navigation-dropdown-link
            ></pds-list-item
          >
        </pds-list>
      </pds-primary-navigation-main-menu-item>
      <pds-primary-navigation-main-menu-item megamenu text="Megamenu">
        <pds-grid variant="1-3up" break="slower">
          <pds-grid-item>
            <placeholder-element>Item 1</placeholder-element>
          </pds-grid-item>
          <pds-grid-item>
            <placeholder-element>Item 2</placeholder-element>
          </pds-grid-item>
          <pds-grid-item>
            <placeholder-element>Item 3</placeholder-element>
          </pds-grid-item>
          <pds-grid-item>
            <placeholder-element>Item 4</placeholder-element>
          </pds-grid-item>
          <pds-grid-item>
            <placeholder-element>Item 5</placeholder-element>
          </pds-grid-item>
          <pds-grid-item>
            <placeholder-element>Item 6</placeholder-element>
          </pds-grid-item>
        </pds-grid>
      </pds-primary-navigation-main-menu-item>
      <pds-primary-navigation-main-menu-item
        href="#"
        text="Link"
      ></pds-primary-navigation-main-menu-item>
    </pds-primary-navigation-main-menu>`,
}

slots.name: default

slots.description: Use this slot instead of the label property, if the label requires additonal markup.
slots.name: label

slots.description: Use this slot if markup should be inserted after the label.
slots.name: label-after

slots.name: labelAfter

slots.description: Use this slot instead of the helpText property, if the help text requires additonal markup.
slots.name: help-text

members.name: spacing
members.description:
The amount of space between the radio buttons.

- **default**
- **sm** condense the spacing between radios

members.name: updateField
members.description: update the actual field's value

members.name: setRadios
members.description: set the name and disabled property of the children radios

members.name: updateRadios
members.description: update the name and disabled property of the children radios

members.name: handleFocus
members.description:
Listening to focus on the group of radios. Once it gets focus,
pass the focus down to the appropriate radio.

members.name: handleFocusOut
members.description:
Listening to focusout since that event bubbles. We do end up
getting all of the focusout events from the children, so in
order to tell that this is a "blur" from the component, this
is looking at the inner radios to check if any other them still
have focus.

members.name: labelTemplate
members.description:
This function renders the radio groups "label"
which in this case is actually a <legend>.

members.name: radioTemplate
members.description:
This function renders a div, that is a parent to the actual radios,
that helps manage the focus/tab behavior for the radios.

members.name: value
members.description: The value of the form field.

members.name: label
members.description:
The label of the form field.
Must be plain text.
If label requires additional markup (e.g., superscript),
then use the label slot instead.

members.name: hideLabel
members.description:
Makes the label screen-reader-only and visually hidden.
Hiding the label is **strongly discouraged** and should only
be used when descriptive text exists elsewhere on the page.

members.name: name
members.description: The name of the form field. This is a **required** property.

members.name: fieldId
members.description:
The id of the form field.

Overrides the auto-generated id.

members.name: required
members.description: Indicates that the form field is required.

members.name: disabled
members.description: Indicates that the form field is disabled.

members.name: readonly
members.description: Indicates that the form field is readonly.

members.name: helpText
members.description:
The additional context used to assist the
user in filling out the form field.

members.name: errorMessage
members.description:
The error message to display when the form
field is in an invalid state.

members.name: formResetCallback
members.description:
Reset the field's value to it's value attribute.
This gets called when `form.reset()` is invoked
(typically by clicking a type="reset" button).

members.name: setInternalValidity
members.description:
Calls `setValidity` on the element internals
with the appropriate options depending on whether
the element has an `errorMessage` or not.

members.name: hasHelpText
members.description: Determines whether the element includes `helpText`

members.name: getAriaDescribedBy
members.description:
Gets the appropriate `aria-describedby` value
based on the existence of `helpText` and `errorMessage`.

members.name: getFieldId
members.description: Gets the "fieldId" value

members.name: verifyLabel
members.description:
Determines whether the element has a label.
Console logs an error, if not.

members.name: helpTextTemplate
members.description:
Creates an HTML template for help text,
if the element has help text.
Adds an `id` that is included in the form field's
aria-describedby attribute.

members.name: errorMessageTemplate
members.description:
Creates an HTML template for error message,
if the `errorMessage` prop is defined.
Adds an `id` that is included in the form field's
aria-describedby attribute.

declarations.default:
{
  name: 'With active secondary nav item link',
  args: {
    title: 'Account/Product Name',
    description: 'Optional description placeholder',
  },
  render: (args) =>
    html`<pds-secondary-navigation
      title="${args.title || nothing}"
      description="${args.description || nothing}"
    >
      <pds-secondary-navigation-level-one
        title="Menu item one"
        columns="2col"
        .activeSectionCallback="${() => {}}"
      >
        <pds-secondary-navigation-level-two
          title="Category one"
          .activePageCallback="${customActivePageFunction}"
        >
          <pds-list spacing="sm">
            <pds-list-item
              ><pds-secondary-navigation-link href="/relative-path"
                >Link one</pds-secondary-navigation-link
              ></pds-list-item
            >
            <pds-list-item
              ><pds-secondary-navigation-link href="#"
                >Link two</pds-secondary-navigation-link
              ></pds-list-item
            >
            <pds-list-item
              ><pds-secondary-navigation-link href="#" variant="emphasis"
                >Link three</pds-secondary-navigation-link
              ></pds-list-item
            >
          </pds-list>
        </pds-secondary-navigation-level-two>
        <pds-secondary-navigation-level-two
          title="Category two"
          .activePageCallback="${customActivePageFunction}"
        >
          <pds-list spacing="sm">
            <pds-list-item
              ><pds-secondary-navigation-link href="#"
                >Link one</pds-secondary-navigation-link
              ></pds-list-item
            >
            <pds-list-item
              ><pds-secondary-navigation-link href="#"
                >Link two</pds-secondary-navigation-link
              ></pds-list-item
            >
            <pds-list-item
              ><pds-secondary-navigation-link href="#"
                >Link three</pds-secondary-navigation-link
              ></pds-list-item
            >
            <pds-list-item
              ><pds-secondary-navigation-link href="#"
                >Link four</pds-secondary-navigation-link
              ></pds-list-item
            >
          </pds-list>
        </pds-secondary-navigation-level-two></pds-secondary-navigation-level-one
      >
      <pds-secondary-navigation-level-one
        title="Menu item two"
        .activeSectionCallback="${() => {}}"
      >
        <pds-secondary-navigation-level-two
          .activePageCallback="${customActivePageFunction}"
          title="Link one"
          href="#"
        ></pds-secondary-navigation-level-two>
        <pds-secondary-navigation-level-two
          .activePageCallback="${customActivePageFunction}"
          title="Link two"
          href="#"
        ></pds-secondary-navigation-level-two>
        <pds-secondary-navigation-level-two
          .activePageCallback="${customActivePageFunction}"
          title="Link three"
          href="#"
        ></pds-secondary-navigation-level-two>
        <pds-secondary-navigation-level-two
          title="Link four"
          .activePageCallback="${customActivePageFunction}"
          href="${window.location.href}"
        ></pds-secondary-navigation-level-two>
      </pds-secondary-navigation-level-one>
      <pds-secondary-navigation-level-one
        title="Menu item three"
        .activeSectionCallback="${() => {}}"
        href="#"
      ></pds-secondary-navigation-level-one>
    </pds-secondary-navigation>`,
  parameters: {
    happo: {
      beforeScreenshot: () => {
        const clickEvent = new MouseEvent('click', {
          view: window,
          bubbles: true,
          cancelable: false,
        });

        const component = document?.querySelector('pds-secondary-navigation');

        const collapsibleEl = component?.shadowRoot
          ?.querySelector('pds-collapsible')
          ?.shadowRoot?.querySelector('.pds-c-collapsible__summary');

        collapsibleEl?.dispatchEvent(clickEvent);

        component
          ?.querySelectorAll('pds-secondary-navigation-level-one')
          .forEach(
            (el) =>
              el?.shadowRoot
                ?.querySelector('pds-collapsible')
                ?.shadowRoot?.querySelector('.pds-c-collapsible__summary')
                ?.dispatchEvent(clickEvent),
          );

        component
          ?.querySelectorAll('pds-secondary-navigation-level-two')[1]
          ?.shadowRoot?.querySelector('pds-collapsible')
          ?.shadowRoot?.querySelector('.pds-c-collapsible__summary')
          ?.dispatchEvent(clickEvent);

        const buttonEl = component
          ?.querySelectorAll('pds-secondary-navigation-level-one')[1]
          ?.shadowRoot?.querySelector('button');

        buttonEl?.dispatchEvent(clickEvent);
      },
      delay: 500,
    },
  },
}

Default
Active
PdsSecondaryNavigationLink

members.name: variant
members.description:
**default** renders link for basic action
- **emphasis** provide more affordance
- **inverted** used on a darker background
- **emphasis-inverted** more affordance on a darker background

members.name: activePage
members.description:
Set to true for visual representation of the user's current page
If not set, logic in the secondary-navigation-level-two component
will determine if this is the active page by matching the href
to window.location.href

members.name: size
members.description:
**default** renders default size
- **sm** smaller size
- **lg** larger size (not valid for link button)
- **xl** extra large size (not valid for link button)

members.name: href
members.description: Redirect url

members.name: download
members.description: Indicates that the link references a file to download, see https://www.w3schools.com/tags/att_a_download.asp

members.name: rel
members.description:
Specifies information about a linked document
Automatically set to 'noopener noreferrer' when target is '_blank'

members.name: hreflang
members.description: Specifies the two-character language code of the document in the link

members.name: target
members.description: Specifes target to open the linked document

members.name: ariaLabel
members.description: Specifies an aria-label for the link

members.name: ariaCurrent
members.description: Specifies an aria-current for the link

members.name: role
members.description: Specifies a role for the link

members.name: type
members.description:
Specifies the Internet media type (formerly known as MIME type)
of the linked document for links, or the type of button if button
property is true

members.name: button
members.description:
Render the link as a button variant

- **default** renders the button used for the most common calls to action that don't require as much visual attention.
- **default-inverted** renders a default button for use on darker backgrounds.
- **primary** renders the button used for the most important calls to action.
- **primary-inverted** renders a primary button for use on darker backgrounds.
- **icon** renders the button used for icon.
- **icon-inverted** renders the button for icons used on darker backgrounds.

members.name: hover
members.description: Programatically indicate a link should display as hover state

The label of the form field.
Must be plain text.
If label requires additional markup (e.g., superscript),
then use the label slot instead.

attributes.name: hideLabel
attributes.description:
Makes the label screen-reader-only and visually hidden.
Hiding the label is **strongly discouraged** and should only
be used when descriptive text exists elsewhere on the page.

attributes.description: The name of the form field. This is a **required** property.

The id of the form field.

Overrides the auto-generated id.

attributes.description: Indicates that the form field is required.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: Indicates that the form field is readonly.

attributes.name: helpText
attributes.description:
The additional context used to assist the
user in filling out the form field.

attributes.name: errorMessage
attributes.description:
The error message to display when the form
field is in an invalid state.

declarations.summary:
This component presents a session warning to authenticated users when the active session is expiring

This component relies on a middle layer application to provide it timeout data from the backend session service,
and fires the below events to communicate with the middle layer.

The component writes data to local storage to keep the session timer of all open browser windows in sync using the 'pdsSessionValue' key.

- Values greater than zero in the local storage will set the countdown timer for that many milliseconds into the future
- Value of zero will indicate an expired session and cause the component to emit a logout requested event
- Any other value will not set a timer

members.name: striped
members.description: Boolean to determine if the table should have "zebra" striping

members.name: expandAllOnLoad
members.description: Boolean to expand all rows on a collapsible table on initial page load

members.name: removeBorder
members.description: Boolean to remove the borders and rounded corners of the table.  Default is false.

members.name: hoverableRows
members.description: Boolean to add hoverable rows functionality to the table.  Default is false.

members.name: stickyHeader
members.description:
Boolean to set the header row to sticky, default is false.

Sticky row header will stick to the top of the page when scrolled away unless the table is fixed height, in which case it will stick to the top of the scrollable container.

members.name: stickyColumn
members.description: Boolean to set the first column to sticky, default is false.

members.name: fixedHeight
members.description: String to set a fixed height for the table. Example values: 300px, .25vh, 25%

members.description: Set the child elements to be focusable or remove them from the tab order, based on if they're shown/hidden

members.name: labelRight

members.description: Indicates whether the switch is toggled.

members.name: labelTemplate
members.description:
Creates an HTML template for the label
that is tied to the form field via the `for`
attribute and adds the required indicator,
if applicable.

members.name: value
members.description: The value of the form field.

members.name: label
members.description:
The label of the form field.
Must be plain text.
If label requires additional markup (e.g., superscript),
then use the label slot instead.

members.name: hideLabel
members.description:
Makes the label screen-reader-only and visually hidden.
Hiding the label is **strongly discouraged** and should only
be used when descriptive text exists elsewhere on the page.

members.name: name
members.description: The name of the form field. This is a **required** property.

members.name: fieldId
members.description:
The id of the form field.

Overrides the auto-generated id.

members.name: required
members.description: Indicates that the form field is required.

members.name: disabled
members.description: Indicates that the form field is disabled.

members.name: readonly
members.description: Indicates that the form field is readonly.

members.name: helpText
members.description:
The additional context used to assist the
user in filling out the form field.

members.name: errorMessage
members.description:
The error message to display when the form
field is in an invalid state.

members.name: formResetCallback
members.description:
Reset the field's value to it's value attribute.
This gets called when `form.reset()` is invoked
(typically by clicking a type="reset" button).

members.name: setInternalValidity
members.description:
Calls `setValidity` on the element internals
with the appropriate options depending on whether
the element has an `errorMessage` or not.

members.name: updateField
members.description: update the actual field's value

members.name: hasHelpText
members.description: Determines whether the element includes `helpText`

members.name: getAriaDescribedBy
members.description:
Gets the appropriate `aria-describedby` value
based on the existence of `helpText` and `errorMessage`.

members.name: getFieldId
members.description: Gets the "fieldId" value

members.name: verifyLabel
members.description:
Determines whether the element has a label.
Console logs an error, if not.

members.name: helpTextTemplate
members.description:
Creates an HTML template for help text,
if the element has help text.
Adds an `id` that is included in the form field's
aria-describedby attribute.

members.name: errorMessageTemplate
members.description:
Creates an HTML template for error message,
if the `errorMessage` prop is defined.
Adds an `id` that is included in the form field's
aria-describedby attribute.

members.name: value
members.description: The value of the form field.

members.name: size
members.description:
The size of the component.

- **default**
- **sm** renders a the small version of the input

NOTE: This is NOT the HTML size attribute that controls the width of the input.

members.name: type
members.description:
Standard input type attribute.
See [HTML attribute: type](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input)

- **email** - use for inputs that take an email
- **number** - use for inputs that take number values
- **password** - use for inputs that take passwords
- **search** - use for inputs used for searches
- **text** - use for inputs that take alphanumeric text
- **url** - use for inputs that take urls

Explicitly exclude the following input types:

- **button** - use PdsButton component with `type="button"`
- **checkbox** - use the PdsCheckbox component
- **color**
- **date**
- **datetime-local**
- **file**
- **hidden** - not needed for a design system
- **tel** - use the PDSPhoneNumberInput instead
- **image**
- **month**
- **radio** - use the PdsRadioGroup component
- **range**
- **reset** - use the PdsButton component with `type="reset"`
- **submit** - use the PdsButton component with `type="submit"`
- **time**
- **week**

members.name: autocomplete
members.description:
Standard input autocomplete attribute.
See [HTML attribute: autocomplete](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/autocomplete)

Note: this explicitly excludes the tel autocomplete values since type tel is not a valid option for this component.

members.description:
The masking pattern to apply to the input field.

- **ssn**
- **tax-id**

If using `maskType`, then `type` property must be set to "text".

Standard input autocomplete attribute.
See [HTML attribute: autocomplete](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/autocomplete)

Note: this explicitly excludes the tel autocomplete values since type tel is not a valid option for this component.

attributes.name: maskType
attributes.description:
The masking pattern to apply to the input field.

- **ssn**
- **tax-id**

If using `maskType`, then `type` property must be set to "text".

attributes.name: label
attributes.description:
The label of the form field.
Must be plain text.
If label requires additional markup (e.g., superscript),
then use the label slot instead.

attributes.name: hideLabel
attributes.description:
Makes the label screen-reader-only and visually hidden.
Hiding the label is **strongly discouraged** and should only
be used when descriptive text exists elsewhere on the page.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the form field. This is a **required** property.

attributes.name: fieldId
attributes.description:
The id of the form field.

Overrides the auto-generated id.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Indicates that the form field is required.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Indicates that the form field is disabled.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: Indicates that the form field is readonly.

attributes.name: helpText
attributes.description:
The additional context used to assist the
user in filling out the form field.

attributes.name: errorMessage
attributes.description:
The error message to display when the form
field is in an invalid state.

members.name: value
members.description:
The default text value.

There is no HTML "value" attribute on the native `<textarea>` element.
Set the "value" on the `<pds-text-area>` web component to render default text content.
The default text is wrapped in the `<textarea>` tags, ie `<textarea>Default text content.</textarea>`.

members.name: size
members.description:
The size of the component.

- **default**
- **sm** renders a the small version of the textarea

NOTE: This is NOT the HTML size attribute that controls the width of the textarea.

members.name: minLength
members.description:
Standard textarea minlength attribute.
See [HTML attribute: minlenth](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/minlenth)

members.name: maxLength
members.description:
Standard textarea maxlength attribute.
See [HTML attribute: maxlength](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/maxlength)

members.name: resize
members.description:
Resize controls.
Set to an allowed value of 'smart', 'manual', 'horizontal', 'vertical' or 'none'.
The default value is 'smart' which automatically resizes based on content height.
Works via CSS style rule that targets the attribute name and value.
See [Controlling whether a textarea is resizable](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/textarea#controlling_whether_a_textarea_is_resizable)
- **smart** causes automatic resizing of height based on content entry
- **manual** allows for resizing in all directions
- **horizontal** allows for resizing horizontally
- **vertical** allows for resizing vertically
- **none** disables resizing

members.name: updateField
members.description: update the actual field's value

members.name: label
members.description:
The label of the form field.
Must be plain text.
If label requires additional markup (e.g., superscript),
then use the label slot instead.

members.name: hideLabel
members.description:
Makes the label screen-reader-only and visually hidden.
Hiding the label is **strongly discouraged** and should only
be used when descriptive text exists elsewhere on the page.

members.name: name
members.description: The name of the form field. This is a **required** property.

members.name: fieldId
members.description:
The id of the form field.

Overrides the auto-generated id.

members.name: required
members.description: Indicates that the form field is required.

members.name: disabled
members.description: Indicates that the form field is disabled.

members.name: readonly
members.description: Indicates that the form field is readonly.

members.name: helpText
members.description:
The additional context used to assist the
user in filling out the form field.

members.name: errorMessage
members.description:
The error message to display when the form
field is in an invalid state.

members.name: formResetCallback
members.description:
Reset the field's value to it's value attribute.
This gets called when `form.reset()` is invoked
(typically by clicking a type="reset" button).

members.name: setInternalValidity
members.description:
Calls `setValidity` on the element internals
with the appropriate options depending on whether
the element has an `errorMessage` or not.

members.name: hasHelpText
members.description: Determines whether the element includes `helpText`

members.name: getAriaDescribedBy
members.description:
Gets the appropriate `aria-describedby` value
based on the existence of `helpText` and `errorMessage`.

members.name: getFieldId
members.description: Gets the "fieldId" value

members.name: verifyLabel
members.description:
Determines whether the element has a label.
Console logs an error, if not.

members.name: labelTemplate
members.description:
Creates an HTML template for the label
that is tied to the form field via the `for`
attribute and adds the required indicator,
if applicable.

members.name: helpTextTemplate
members.description:
Creates an HTML template for help text,
if the element has help text.
Adds an `id` that is included in the form field's
aria-describedby attribute.

members.name: errorMessageTemplate
members.description:
Creates an HTML template for error message,
if the `errorMessage` prop is defined.
Adds an `id` that is included in the form field's
aria-describedby attribute.

{
  name: 'Link',
  args: {
    variant: 'default',
    placement: 'bottom',
  },
  render: (args: any) =>
    html`<pds-tooltip
      variant="${args.variant || nothing}"
      placement="${args.placement || nothing}"
      ><pds-button
        slot="trigger"
        link="default"
        ariaLabel="This button triggers a tooltip"
        >This is a button that looks like a link</pds-button
      >Tooltip content</pds-tooltip
    >`,
}

members.description: A title to display under the video; if provided, will also be used to replace the video title for screen readers

members.description:
A description to display under the video; should only be used if videoTitle is provided, and it will display between the title and transcript link
Should be passed in as a string of HTML, sanitization is handled within PDS

members.name: compareTimeProgress
members.description:
This method compares the current timestamp of a video with the total length of the video
It then returns a boolean so we can dispatch an event when a user gets to 25%, 50%, 75%, and 90% of a video

declarations.name: meta
Sample
declarations.default:
{
  name: 'Sample',
  render() {
    return html`<form-example>
      <form>
        <pds-text-input
          name="name"
          label="Enter your name"
          value="Harry Potter"
          class="pds-u-padding-bottom-12"
        ></pds-text-input>
        <pds-date-picker-input
          class="pds-u-padding-vertical-12"
          name="start date"
          dateformat="MM/DD/YYYY"
          helptext="Please follow the MM/DD/YYYY format."
          label="Select a start date"
          ><pds-date-picker slot="datepicker"></pds-date-picker
        ></pds-date-picker-input>
        <pds-select
          name="house"
          label="Select a house"
          value="Hufflepuff"
          class="pds-u-padding-vertical-12"
        >
          <option value="Slytherin">Slytherin</option>
          <option value="Hufflepuff">Hufflepuff</option>
          <option value="Ravenclaw">Ravenclaw</option>
          <option value="Gryffindor">Gryffindor</option>
        </pds-select>
        <pds-radio-group
          class="pds-u-padding-vertical-12"
          name="pet"
          label="Select your pet"
          value="Frog"
        >
          <pds-radio value="Cat" label="Cat"></pds-radio>
          <pds-radio value="Frog" label="Frog"></pds-radio>
          <pds-radio value="Owl" label="Owl"></pds-radio>
        </pds-radio-group>
        <pds-text-area
          class="pds-u-padding-vertical-12"
          name="ingredients"
          label="List the ingredients for Polyjuice potion"
          value="Lacewing flies, etc..."
        ></pds-text-area>
        <pds-checkbox
          class="pds-u-padding-top-12 pds-u-padding-bottom-48"
          name="oath"
          label="I solemnly swear I'm up to no good."
          checked
        ></pds-checkbox>
        <pds-button type="submit" variant="primary">Submit</pds-button>
      </form>
    </form-example>`;
  },
}
